## Lab activity 2 - Miller and Haden data

#1. Loading the relevant libraries

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(broom)
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```
:::
:::

#2. Read in the data

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mh <- read_csv("MillerHadenData.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 25 Columns: 5
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
dbl (5): Participant, Abil, IQ, Home, TV

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::
:::


#3.  Construct a scatterplot of the relationship between 'Home' and 'TV'. Also add a line of best fit.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(mh, aes(x = Home, y = TV)) + 
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(x = "Time spend reading at home", y = "Time spend watching TV at home")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}

:::
:::
